00046 struct broken_constraint : public std::logic_error
00047 {
00048 
00051     explicit broken_constraint(const std::string & what =
00052         "Attempt to give constrained object a value that is not constraint-conforming.")
00053         : std::logic_error(what)
00054     { }
00055 
00056 };
00057 
00063 template <typename ExceptionType = broken_constraint>
00064 struct throw_exception
00065 {
00066 
00068     typedef ExceptionType exception_type;
00069 
00074     template <typename V, typename C>
00075     void operator () (const V &, const V &, const C &) const
00076     {
00077         BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION( exception_type() );
00078     }
00079 
00080 };

00122 template <
00123     typename ValueType,
00124     typename ConstraintPolicy = boost::function1<bool, const ValueType &>,
00125     typename ErrorPolicy = throw_exception<>
00126 >
00127 class constrained {
00128 
00129 
00130 public:
00131 
00132 // Remember the template's actual parameters:
00133 
00135     typedef ValueType value_type;
00136 
00138     typedef ConstraintPolicy constraint_type;
00139 
00141     typedef ErrorPolicy error_handler_type;
00142 
00143 
00144 // Access to the value and constraint:
00145 
00147     const value_type & value() const
00148     { return _value_and_policies.value; }
00149 
00152     operator const value_type & () const
00153     { return value(); }
00154 
00156     const constraint_type & constraint() const
00157     { return _value_and_policies.first(); }
00158 
00160     const error_handler_type & error_handler() const
00161     { return _value_and_policies.second(); }
00162 
00164     error_handler_type & error_handler()
00165     { return _value_and_policies.second(); }
00166 
00167 
00168 // Special member functions and swap:
00169 
00179     constrained()
00180         : _value_and_policies()
00181     { _initialize(); }
00182 
00183     // Using implicitly-declared other special member functions.
00184 
00187     void swap(constrained & other)
00188     { _value_and_policies.swap(other._value_and_policies); }
00189

00208     template <typename V, typename C, typename E>
00209     explicit constrained(const constrained<V, C, E> & other)
00210         : _value_and_policies(other.value(), other.constraint(), other.error_handler())
00211     { _initialize(); }

00223         : _value_and_policies(v)

00300 
00301 // Assignment operators:
00302 
00319     template <typename V, typename C, typename E>
00320     constrained & operator = (const constrained<V, C, E> & other)
00321     {
00322         constrained tmp(other);
00323         swap(tmp);
00324         return *this;
00325     }
00326 
00335     constrained & operator = (const value_type & v)
00336     {
00337         if( constraint()(v) )
00338             _value() = v;
00339         else
00340             error_handler()(_value(), v, _constraint());
00341 
00342         BOOST_ASSERT( constraint()(value()) );
00343 
00344         return *this;
00345     }
00346 
00347 
00348 private:
00349 
00350 // Private helper functions:
00351 
00356     void _initialize()
00357     {
00358         if( !constraint()(value()) )
00359         {
00360             error_handler()(_value(), value(), _constraint());
00361             BOOST_ASSERT( constraint()(value()) );
00362         }
00363     }
00364 
00366     value_type & _value()
00367     { return _value_and_policies.value; }
00368 
00370     constraint_type & _constraint()
00371     { return _value_and_policies.first(); }
00372 
00373 
00374 // The value and policies holder:
00375 
00390     struct _value_and_policies_holder :
00391         public boost::compressed_pair<constraint_type, error_handler_type>
00392     {
00393 
00394         typedef boost::compressed_pair<constraint_type, error_handler_type> base;
00395 
00396         value_type value;
00397 
00398     // Construction:
00399 
00400         _value_and_policies_holder()
00401             : base(), value()
00402         {
00403             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( !boost::is_pod<constraint_type>::value
00404                 || boost::is_empty<constraint_type>::value ));
00405             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( !boost::is_pod<error_handler_type>::value
00406                 || boost::is_empty<error_handler_type>::value ));
00407         }
00408 
00409         _value_and_policies_holder(const value_type & v)
00410             : base(), value(v)
00411         {
00412             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( !boost::is_pod<constraint_type>::value
00413                 || boost::is_empty<constraint_type>::value ));
00414             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( !boost::is_pod<error_handler_type>::value
00415                 || boost::is_empty<error_handler_type>::value ));
00416         }
00417 
00418         _value_and_policies_holder(const constraint_type & c)
00419             : base(c), value()
00420         {
00421             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( !boost::is_pod<error_handler_type>::value
00422                 || boost::is_empty<error_handler_type>::value ));
00423         }
00424 
00425         _value_and_policies_holder(const error_handler_type & e)
00426             : base(e), value()
00427         {
00428             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( !boost::is_pod<constraint_type>::value
00429                 || boost::is_empty<constraint_type>::value ));
00430         }
00431 
00432         _value_and_policies_holder(const value_type & v, const constraint_type & c)
00433             : base(c), value(v)
00434         {
00435             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( !boost::is_pod<error_handler_type>::value
00436                 || boost::is_empty<error_handler_type>::value ));
00437         }
00438 
00439         _value_and_policies_holder(const value_type & v, const error_handler_type & e)
00440             : base(e), value(v)
00441         {
00442             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( !boost::is_pod<constraint_type>::value
00443                 || boost::is_empty<constraint_type>::value ));
00444         }
00445 
00446         _value_and_policies_holder(const constraint_type & c, const error_handler_type & e)
00447             : base(c, e), value()
00448         { }
00449 
00450         _value_and_policies_holder(
00451             const value_type & v, const constraint_type & c, const error_handler_type & e)
00452             : base(c, e), value(v)
00453         { }
00454 
00455     // Swap:
00456 
00457         void swap(_value_and_policies_holder & other)
00458         {
00459             base::swap(other);
00460             boost::swap(value, other.value);
00461         }
00462 
00463     }; // struct _value_and_policies_holder
00464 
00466     _value_and_policies_holder _value_and_policies;
00467

00469 }; // class constrained<>

00475 template <typename V, typename C, typename E>
00476 void swap(constrained<V, C, E> & lhs, constrained<V, C, E> & rhs)
00477 {
00478     lhs.swap(rhs);
00479 }

00496 template <typename V, typename C, typename E, typename T>
00497 void change_constraint(constrained<V, C, E> & c, const T & new_constraint)
00498 {
00499     constrained<V, C, E> tmp(c.value(), new_constraint, c.error_handler());
00500     c.swap(tmp);
00501 }

00505 // Increment/decrement operators:
00506 
00513 template <typename V, typename C, typename E>
00514 constrained<V, C, E> & operator ++ (constrained<V, C, E> & c)
00515 {
00516     V tmp(c.value());
00517     ++tmp;
00518     c = tmp;
00519     return c;
00520 }
00521 
00528 template <typename V, typename C, typename E>
00529 constrained<V, C, E> & operator -- (constrained<V, C, E> & c)
00530 {
00531     V tmp(c.value());
00532     --tmp;
00533     c = tmp;
00534     return c;
00535 }
00536 
00543 template <typename V, typename C, typename E>
00544 const constrained<V, C, E> operator ++ (constrained<V, C, E> & c, int)
00545 {
00546     const constrained<V, C, E> tmp(c);
00547     ++c;
00548     return tmp;
00549 }
00550 
00557 template <typename V, typename C, typename E>
00558 const constrained<V, C, E> operator -- (constrained<V, C, E> & c, int)
00559 {
00560     const constrained<V, C, E> tmp(c);
00561     --c;
00562     return tmp;

00567 // Overloaded arithmetic and bitwise assignment operators:
00568 
00569 #ifdef BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR
00570 #    error "BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR already defined."
00571 #else
00572 #    define BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(_op_, _op_name_)            \
00573                                                                                      \
00574  \
00575  \
00576  \
00577  \
00578  \
00579  \
00580  \
00581  \
00582 template <typename V, typename C, typename E, typename T>                            \
00583 constrained<V, C, E> & operator _op_##= (constrained<V, C, E> & c, const T & v)      \
00584 {                                                                                    \
00585     V tmp(c.value());                                                                \
00586     tmp _op_##= v;                                                                   \
00587     c = tmp;                                                                         \
00588     return c;                                                                        \
00589 }
00590 
00591 BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(+, +=)

00593 BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(*, *=)
00594 BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(/, /=)
00595 BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(%, \%=)
00596 BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(^, ^=)
00597 BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(&, &=)
00598 BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(|, |=)
00599 BOOST_DEFINE_CONSTRAINED_ASSIGNMENT_OPERATOR(>>, >>=)

00607 // Stream input/output operators:
00608 
00609 #ifndef BOOST_NO_IOSFWD
00610 
00626 template <typename Ch, class Tr, typename V, typename C, typename E>
00627 std::basic_istream<Ch, Tr> &
00628 operator >> (std::basic_istream<Ch, Tr> & is, constrained<V, C, E> & c)
00629 {
00630     V tmp(c.value());
00631     is >> tmp;
00632     if( is )
00633         c = tmp;
00634     return is;
00635 }
00636 
00650 template <typename Ch, class Tr, typename V, typename C, typename E>
00651 std::basic_ostream<Ch, Tr> &
00652 operator << (std::basic_ostream<Ch, Tr> & os, const constrained<V, C, E> & c)
00653 {
00654     os << c.value();
00655     return os;
00656 }
